author: Evgeny Kuzyakov | FASTNEAR
content:
I found a way to monitor the protocol version of each validator, but it will not be visible before the start of the voting. So for now you have to rely on grafana and telemetry collected by NearOne. 

Once the protocol voting starts at Tuesday, October 28th, 2025, at 01:00:00 UTC, validators will start providing their version in block headers as well as it can be queried from the debug RPC.

With the help of Near One, we've got a script that returns the version of the protocol for each validator. This can be queried from an RPC node with debug mode enabled. The actual protocol version will start to appear after the voting.

https://gist.github.com/darioush/be8e30ade6bfa59dda5381aef176cae6?permalink_comment_id=5822117#gistcomment-5822117

author: Yoon

author: Waclaw Banasik
content:
Only the top 100 validators can vote. These validators are the block and chunk producers. The chunk validators do not participate in voting and I would encourage them to upgrade to avoid risk of being kicked out. The same goes for non-validator nodes (RPC, archival). For those nodes upgrading can prevent being kicked out and there is no downside. 

All release binaries are backward compatible and support the current and the newly proposed protocol version. The operators that upgraded to 2.9 will not need to downgrade. 

In the case that the voting does not go through in the specified timeline, we will provide instruction on how to safely off-board the 2.9 binary. The technical details are to be figured out but most likely it will by a new release, 2.10, that brings the inflation back and "jumps over" the inflation decrease. We want to avoid having two different binaries at the same protocol version or we might accidentaly fork the network.

author: Gonzalo
content:
Hi!
In the previous upgrade (from 2.8.0 to 2.9.0), it was announced that there would be two epochs to prepare, but the upgrade happened immediately. We have one script ready to compile the new neard binary, but it would be very helpful to have a public and reliable source indicating when the upgrade will take place and what the preparation window will be. This would allow us to fully automate the process. And not be kicked again ğŸ˜…
Thanks a lot for your work and support
